message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SI, cs.LG, cs.NA, cs.SP. 

The paper deals with the problem of denoising and interpolation of continuous-time sparse stochastic processes, which involves statistical estimation and signal processing. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.IT (Information Theory), which deals with the mathematical foundations of information processing, including statistical inference and signal processing. 

The paper also uses tools from the theory of splines, which are widely used in computational geometry and computer graphics, suggesting a possible fit with cs.SI (Computational Geometry) or cs.GR (Computer Graphics). 

The paper also discusses the comparison of the derived statistical methods with well-known techniques for the recovery of sparse signals, such as l1 norm and Log (l1-l0 relaxation) regularization methods, which are commonly used in machine learning and optimization. This suggests a possible fit with cs.LG (Machine Learning) or cs.NA (Numerical Analysis). 

Finally, the paper deals with the problem of estimating continuous-time stochastic processes, which is a topic of interest in signal processing and control theory, suggesting a possible fit with cs.SP (Signal Processing).
